hanzi-su-wiki:
兇

Значения

Злодейский

Мнемоника

Волчья яма с острыми кольями крест-накрест на дне, приготовленная злым человеком для прохожих 儿.

Варианты

凶

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The cruel villain's favorite hobby is breaking human legs.
humanum_full_description_en:
Warring States and Xiaozhuan from " Jie ", " fierce " is also sound, " fierce " as ground subsidence, represent a dangerous trap, " Jie knelt the" elephant man, who under the trap, represent the terrible, dangerous (Xu Shen ). The original meaning is dangerous and terrible. "Shuowen": "Fierce, disturbing fear. From the people under the fierce. "The Spring and Autumn Biography" says: "Cao people are fierce and fearful." "Zuo Zhuan. "Twenty-eight Years of Gong Xi": "Cao Ren is fierce and fearful", Du pre-notes: "Fierce and fierce, fearful."

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are unlucky and dangerous. "Wu Wang Jianfeng" Jane 4: "Gu (desire) conquer righteousness is fierce", meaning that selfish desire surpasses justice is dangerous. "Shangbo Bamboo Book Seven. "Wu Wang Jianfeng" Jane 14: "If you want to overcome will, you will be fierce." It means that if selfish desire trumps will, it is dangerous. He also expressed fierceness, "Shangbo Zhushu Six. "Yongyue" Jane 13: "Cruel Well (Punishment) Severe Government", which means fierce punishment and severe politics.

During the Warring States Period, the seal of Zhao's seal was " Hungary ", which was used as the name of the country. "Ancient Seals Compilation" 94: "Ferocious (Hung) Nu", "Hun" is found in "Historical Records. Biography of the Xiongnu, in the vast area north of the Zhao Great Wall to Mongolia (He Linyi).

Regarding the difference between " bad " and " bad, " see " bad ".
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The characters of the Warring States Period and the Xiaozhuan both start with " Jie " and " Fero ", and " Fero " is also a sound symbol. " Jie " is like sitting on a human figure kneeling, and " fierce " is like a depression on the ground. Xu Shen thinks that people are very dangerous when they are under " fierce ". The original meaning is dangerous and terrible.
humanum_full_description:
戰國文字和小篆從「卩」，「凶」亦聲，「凶」象地面下陷，表示危險的陷阱，「卩」象跪坐之人，人在陷阱之下，表示可怕、凶險（許慎）。本義是危險可怕。《說文》：「兇，擾恐也。从人在凶下。《春秋傳》曰：『曹人兇懼』。」《左傳．僖公二十八年》：「曹人兇懼」，杜預注：「兇兇，恐懼聲。」

　　戰國竹簡表示不吉利、凶險，《上博竹書七．武王踐阼》簡4：「谷（欲）勝義則兇」，意謂私欲勝過正義則危險。《上博竹書七．武王踐阼》簡14：「欲勝志則兇」，意謂私欲勝過意志則危險。又表示兇狠，《上博竹書六．用曰》簡13：「兇井（刑）厲政」，意謂兇狠的刑罰，嚴厲的政治。

　　戰國時期趙國的璽印文字通假為「匈」，用作國名，《古璽彙編》94：「兇（匈）奴」，「匈奴」見於《史記．匈奴列傳》，在趙長城以北至蒙古的廣大地區（何琳儀）。

　　關於「凶」、「兇」的分別，參見「凶」。
humanum_short_description: 戰國文字和小篆皆從「卩」從「凶」，「凶」亦是聲符。「卩」象跪坐人形，「凶」象地面凹陷，許慎認為人在「凶」下，十分凶險。本義是危險可怕。

Meaning: cruel

Kind: simplified

戰國文字和小篆從「 卩 」，「 凶 」亦聲，「 凶 」象地面下陷，表示危險的陷阱，「 卩 」象跪坐之人，人在陷阱之下，表示可怕、凶險（許慎）。本義是危險可怕。《說文》：「兇，擾恐也。从人在凶下。《春秋傳》曰：『曹人兇懼』。」《左傳．僖公二十八年》：「曹人兇懼」，杜預注：「兇兇，恐懼聲。」 戰國竹簡表示不吉利、凶險，《上博竹書七．武王踐阼》簡4：「谷（欲）勝義則兇」，意謂私欲勝過正義則危險。《上博竹書七．武王踐阼》簡14：「欲勝志則兇」，意謂私欲勝過意志則危險。又表示兇狠，《上博竹書六．用曰》簡13：「兇井（刑）厲政」，意謂兇狠的刑罰，嚴厲的政治。 戰國時期趙國的璽印文字通假為「 匈 」，用作國名，《古璽彙編》94：「兇（匈）奴」，「匈奴」見於《史記．匈奴列傳》，在趙長城以北至蒙古的廣大地區（何琳儀）。 關於「 凶 」、「 兇 」的分別，參見「 凶 」。

The original meaning is dangerous and terrible. "Shuowen": "Fierce, disturbing fear. From the people under the fierce. "The Spring and Autumn Biography" says: "Cao people are fierce and fearful." "Zuo Zhuan. "Twenty-eight Years of Gong Xi": "Cao Ren is fierce and fearful", Du pre-notes: "Fierce and fierce, fearful." The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are unlucky and dangerous. "Wu Wang Jianfeng" Jane 4: "Gu (desire) conquer righteousness is fierce", meaning that selfish desire surpasses justice is dangerous. "Shangbo Bamboo Book Seven. "Wu Wang Jianfeng" Jane 14: "If you want to overcome will, you will be fierce." It means that if selfish desire trumps will, it is dangerous. He also expressed fierceness, "Shangbo Zhushu Six. "Yongyue" Jane 13: "Cruel Well (Punishment) Severe Government", which means fierce punishment and severe politics. During the Warring States Period, the seal of Zhao's seal was " Hungary", which was used as the name of the country. "Ancient Seals Compilation" 94: "Ferocious (Hung) Nu", "Hun" is found in "Historical Records. Biography of the Xiongnu, in the vast area north of the Zhao Great Wall to Mongolia (He Linyi). 兇字的基本解释

兇
xiōng
同“凶”③兇⑤。

兇字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiōng］
［《廣韻》許容切，平鍾，曉。］
［《廣韻》許拱切，上腫，曉。］
(1)恐惧。参见“兇懼”。
(2)恶狠；恶劣。
(3)恶人。
(4)形容死亡、灾难等不幸现象，与“吉”相对。
(5)豪放。
(6)猛，厉害。
(7)方言。训斥。

兇字的康熙字典解释

【子集下】【儿字部】　兇； 康熙笔画：4； 页码：页124第04
【唐韻】【集韻】【正韻】許容切【韻會】虛容切，?音胷。【說文】擾恐也。从人在凶下。【左傳·僖二十八年】曹人兇懼。【玉篇】懼聲也。又【增韻】凶，通作兇。【唐詩】除兇報千古。又【集韻】或作恟忷。又【唐韻】【正韻】許拱切【集韻】【韻會】詡拱切，?胷上聲。義同。

兇字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

兇字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xiōng］
["Guangyun" Xu Rongqie, Ping Zhong, Xiao. ]
["Guangyun" Xu Gongqie, swollen top, Xiao. ]
(1) Fear. See "Fear of fierceness."
(2) Vicious; bad.
(3) The wicked.
(4) Describes unfortunate phenomena such as death and disaster, as opposed to "good luck".
(5) Bold and unrestrained.
(6) Fierce, powerful.
(7) Dialects. rebuke.
fierce
